pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.5_0: The second training rule on obstructing their heads
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.13_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.3.1_0: “‘I will sit well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.4_0: he should sit well-restrained in inhabited areas;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands and feet while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
